description:
The setting for this adaptation is moved from 1970s Japan to 2020, just after the Tokyo Olympics. The story centers on the Mutou family, and the siblings Ayumu and Gou. The four members of the Mutou family are caught in an earthquake that hits Tokyo, and attempt to escape the city, while disaster claws at their heels.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Natural Disaster
tags.description: It focuses on catastrophic events of natural origin, such as earthquakes, tsunamis,  volcanic eruptions, and severe storms. These works often present situations of extreme danger in which the characters struggle to survive and overcome the adversity.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Eco-Horror
tags.description: Utilizes a horrifying depiction of ecology to explore man and its relationship with nature.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: E-Sports
tags.description: Prominently features professional video game competitions, tournaments, players, etc.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Agriculture
tags.description: Prominently features agriculture practices.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

node.description: Sakyo Komatsu was a Japanese science fiction writer and screenwriter, best known for his novel Japan Sinks.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaakiyuasa)

An acclaimed anime director known for his wild, freeform style. 

After graduating from the Kyushu Sangyo University's Faculty of Arts in 1987 he joined studio [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/Ajiado), initially as in-betweener but rapidly moving to key animation. 

In the first part of his career Yuasa established himself as an idiosyncratic creator while working on several child friendly anime, such as [Chibi Maruko-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/951/Chibi-Marukochan/) and [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2677/Doraemon-Nobitas-Animal-Planet/), but especially on [Crayon Shin-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/966/Shin-Chan/), a project he was involved with for most of the '90s. 

One of his breakthrough roles in this period was his participation on the second part of [The Hakkenden](https://anilist.co/anime/12715/The-Hakkenden-Legend-of-the-Dog-Warriors-Part-2/), working as animation director under [Shinya Oohira](https://anilist.co/staff/103893/Shinya-Oohira)'s direction. This OVA was an important outing of the '90s, uniting many veteran artists and talented newcomers. 

He debuted as director on [Mind Game](https://anilist.co/anime/875/Mind-Game/), an abstract piece combining animation and live-action footage, winning the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival (overcoming even Hayao Miyazaki's [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/Howls-Moving-Castle/)), and earning [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/Yoshiyuki-Tomino)'s praise, who acted as the chief judge. After Mind Game Yuasa spent several years at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) working on various projects. In 2013, he founded [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/Science-SARU) alongside his close affiliate [Eun-Yeong Choi](https://anilist.co/staff/115088/EunYeong-Choi).

On March 25, 2020 it was announced Yuasa stepped down as the CEO of Science SARU. He would work there as director until the completion of his latest Movie, [Inu-Oh](https://anilist.co/anime/109928/InuOh/), and would later cease any affiliation with the studio.

On February 17, 2025 it was announced that Yuasa would launch of his own animation studio, ame pippin. Their debut project would be the film [Daisy's Life](https://anilist.co/anime/190574/Hinagiku-no-Jinsei/).

__[Website](https://www.agraph.jp/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4L0gz16xuM1as1OgYzh1SR)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/agraph)__

Kensuke Ushio, alternatively known by stage name agraph, is a Japanese musician, DJ, composer, arranger, programmer, remixer and member of rock band [Lama](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/lama/profile/).

When he was a child Kensuke learned to play the piano, while later at University he started studying arts and music, in addition to also learning how to use audio editing software like Pro Tools. At the age of 20, Kensuke first came in contact with the electronic music world known as techno. 

In 2007, he would start his solo career under the stage name agraph, this is when he started to create his own electronic music. His debut album titled A Day, Phases, produced by Takkyu Ishino, was released in December of 2008. Skipping to 2010, he would release his second album titled Equal which managed to rank in the Japanese Albums Charts.

In 2011, Kensuke and former musicians from the bands Supercar and Number Girl formed a rock band called Lama. The band has released two albums, which both managed to rank in the official Albums Charts of Japan.  It was later revealed that due to his involvement in the rock band Lama, he wouldn't be able to release a third album until 6 years after his second album. His third album titled The Shader was released in 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

**[Website (Kamitsubaki)](https://kanzakiiori.kamitsubaki.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kurogaki0311) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kurogaki0311) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv1KOiaRusvqOR4BrT9Sh8w) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@iori_kanzaki)**

__Introduction:__
__Iori Kanzaki__ is a Japanese Vocaloid producer, singer-songwriter and vocalist.

__Biography:__
In January 2014, he made his debut in Vocaloid-P by posting "[Hankouki](https://youtu.be/nYcSlZKyAD0)".
In 2017, the song "[Inochi ni Kiwarete iru.](https://youtu.be/0HYm60Mjm0k)" was released and has since garnered an impressive 24 million plays as of 2023.
Responsible for writing, composing and arranging all the original songs of the virtual singer "[KAF](https://anilist.co/staff/168254)".
April 2019 saw the release of his first album, "Hakushi," which featured a collection of his popular tracks.
In February 2020, he unveiled a special box set that seamlessly merged his passion for storytelling with his musical talents. This unique release included the first full-length novel, "Beast," along with the EP "[Life is Comedy](https://youtu.be/t-Ux4ccMCGE)."
In September 2020, "Ano Natsu ga Houwa Suru.", a substantially revised edition of the long novel "Beast" initially launched in February, was released by Kawade Shobo.
In June 2021, he ventured into full-scale self-vocals.
Following his first one-man live performance, the release of his second album, "Clumsy Man," followed suit.
The BOX edition of this release also included his new novel, "Shin'ai Naru Anata e," which was published in November 2021 by Kawade Shobo.
A manga adaptation, titled "[Ano Natsu ga Houwa Suru.](https://anilist.co/manga/159516)", based on his first novel of the same name, commenced serialization in August 2022.
In May 2023, after graduating from Kamitsubaki Studio, he launched his own label, Ikuru Shelf, to kickstart his activities.

[Website](http://onukitaeko.jp/)

Oonuki Taeko is a singer-songwriter from Hayama, Miura, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan.

[Website](http://www.sitesakamoto.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryuichisakamoto/)

Ryuuichi Sakamoto was an Academy Award, Grammy, and Golden Globe-winning Japanese musician, composer, record producer and actor, based in New York and Tokyo, Japan. He played the keyboards in the influential electropop band [Yellow Magic Orchestra](https://anilist.co/staff/348229/). His 1999 musical composition "Energy Flow" is the first number-one instrumental single in the Japan's Oricon charts history. He was ranked at number 59 in a list of the top 100 most influential musicians compiled by HMV.

Sakamoto had been married twice. His first marriage took place in 1972 but ended in divorce two years later. Sakamoto has a daughter from this relationship. Sakamoto then married popular Japanese pianist and singer [Yano Akiko](https://anilist.co/staff/170293) in 1982, having collaborated with her on some of her recordings. Sakamoto's second marriage ended in August 2006, 14 years after a mutual decision to live separately—Yano and Sakamoto raised one daughter, J-Pop singer Sakamoto Miu. Also, Sakamoto adopted Yano's son when they got married.

Sakamoto died as a result of his ongoing battle with cancer on March 28, 2023. His death was announced on April 2 through his website and Twitter account.

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Profile (Kamitsubaki Studio)](http://kamitsubaki.jp/artist/kaf/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/virtual_kaf) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/virtual_kaf/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQ1U65-CQdIoZ2_NA4Z4F7A) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@virtual_kaf) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2c32JruIkUyfdycHmhIph4)__

__Kaf__ is a virtual Japanese singer affiliated and managed by Kamitsubaki Studio. She has been uploading original songs and covers to YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok since October 2018. All of her original songs were provided by [Iori Kanzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/180461/Iori-Kanzaki) until 2023, and her character designer is [PALOW](https://anilist.co/staff/306406/PALOW).

[Website](http://onukitaeko.jp/)

Oonuki Taeko is a singer-songwriter from Hayama, Miura, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan.

[Website](http://www.sitesakamoto.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryuichisakamoto/)

**Bruno Méyère** is a French voice actor and director for anime.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- A.J. in "Gutterballs" (French)
- Campbell in "Burn Notice" (French)
- Geek in "Astropia" (French)
- K.C. Guthrie in "Degrassi Next Generation" (French)
- Michelangelo in "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2012" (French)!~

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/teline.carvalho01/) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/teline.carvalho.1)

Teline da Silva Carvalho Duarte, better known as Teline Carvalho, is a Brazilian actress, voice actress and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Emily Fields (Pretty Little Liars)
- Juno (Assassin's Creed franchise)
- Parvati Patil (Harry Potter franchise)
- Keisha Ridenhour (Everybody Hates Chris)
- Daniela Melchior, Fátima Torre, Awkwafina, Teyana Taylor, Sherlyn and Natalia Juárez (Most of the productions)
- Kirby Reed (Scream franchise)
- Samantha "Sam" Giddings (Until Dawn)
- Ryan Wilder / Batwoman (Batwoman)
- Meera Reed [1st voice - 3th-4th season] and Jhiqui (Game of Thrones)
- Braddock (Uncharted)
- Trixie Carter (American Dragon: Jake Long)
- Suki (2nd voice - 2nd season; Avatar: The Last Airbender)
- Sanders (Total Drama Presents: The Ridonculous Race)
- Whitney Houston (I Wanna Dance with Somebody)
- Hermosa Lodge (Riverdale)
- Number 86 (Codename: Kids Next Door)
- Heather (Over the Hedge)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MarcWinslow) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/marcwinslow/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MarcWinslowStudio?mibextid=ZbWKwL) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/WildWinslow)

Marc Winslow is a Mexican singer and voice actor.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Ezreal (League of Legends)
- Peter Maretti (Call of Duty: Black Ops III)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/GongoraAbel) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aberukuma/)

Abel Góngora is a Spanish animator and director known for his work with the Japanese animation studio Science SARU. Having joined the studio as one of its first employees, Góngora serves as the head of Science SARU's digital animation department and has specialized in the use of Adobe Animate.

Góngora began his career in Europe, joining the Irish animation studio Cartoon Saloon in 2006. He initially served as a location designer and later became an animator, working on the television series *"Skunk Fu!"* (2007–08). 

In 2007, Góngora moved to the French animation studio Ankama, where he worked as an animator on the initial seasons of the company's Flash-animated series *"Wakfu"* (2008–12). During this time, Ankama opened a Japanese subsidiary, Ankama Japan, and Góngora was one of the animators who temporarily relocated to Tokyo, where he collaborated with director Masaaki Yuasa. 

After Ankama Japan closed in 2011, Góngora returned to the main Ankama studio in France. However, he remained in touch with Yuasa and his producer associate Eunyoung Choi, and following the foundation of Science SARU in 2013, joined the new company.
Graduated from Tama Art University in 1984.

title.native: 太陽の黙示録 A Spirit of the Sun
